For I have succeeded in making not only your whole family, but every citizen without exception, acknowledge the sincerity of my friendship for you3 with the result that that paragon of women, your wife, as well as those admirably affectionate, gallant, and popular men, your sons, rely implicitly upon my counsel and advice, my zeal and my public policy3 while both the Senate and the people of Rome understand that during your absence you have nothing so quickly available, or so ready to your hand, as the labour, attention, assiduity, and influence you can claim in all that touches your interests from myself.
